conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graphs to determine if the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
The image shows two velocity-time graphs: one for the pedestrian moving at a constant speed of 8 m/s for 8 seconds, and one for the bus starting with uniform acceleration.
The pedestrian covers a distance of 64 meters (8 m/s for 8 seconds).
The bus starts moving with uniform acceleration, and its velocity increases linearly over time.
The bus's initial velocity is 0 m/s, accelerating to 8 m/s in 8 seconds.
The bus covers a distance of 32 meters during the same time period.
The bus is 36 meters away from the pedestrian when the green light turns on.
Since the bus covers 32 meters and the pedestrian covers 64 meters, the pedestrian closes the 36-meter gap.
Therefore, the pedestrian can catch up with the bus.
